H0.text: Which Bourbon whiskey was named in 1933 after the American Colonel who rebuilt the business following the end of Prohibition. Blanton's

H1.text: Which Bourbon whiskey was named in 1933 after the American Colonel who rebuilt the business following the end of Prohibition. Elijah Craig

H2.text: Which Bourbon whiskey was named in 1933 after the American Colonel who rebuilt the business following the end of Prohibition. Booker's

H3.text: Which Bourbon whiskey was named in 1933 after the American Colonel who rebuilt the business following the end of Prohibition. Red Stag

A4.text: The bourbon brand is named in honor of Reverend Elijah Craig (1738/1743 – May 18, 1808), who was a Baptist preacher, educator, and entrepreneur in Fayette County, Virginia, which became Scott County, Kentucky, following Kentucky statehood in 1792.

A5.text: Col. E. H. Taylor – small batch, single-barrel, and barrel proof straight bourbon and rye
